Fruity with black fruits and cedar, leather, earth, peppercorn and mint.
Good quality, spicy and nicely balanced with a long finish. 

Needs a few hours to open up properly, which I did not have. This is a great vintage, and will be better in the next 10 to 15 years. 

A blend of 60% Cabernet and 40% Merlot.

14% alcohol by volume.

90 points.

Tasty right out of the bottle and better as it opens up.

Fruity with black fruits and cedar, leather, earth, peppercorn and mint.
Good quality, spicy and nicely balanced with a long finish. 

Needs a few hours to open up properly, which I did not have. This is a great vintage, and will be better in the next 10 to 15 years. 

A blend of 60% Cabernet and 40% Merlot.

14% alcohol by volume.

90 points.

{"reviews":[{"id":51571699,"rating":4.0,"note":"#Sicily 2013 unpublished

Unusual blend of Viognier/Catarratto (50/50) yielded bright, delicate & well-balanced Donnafugata product.
Polena welcomes us with pale lemon colour with greenish tinges.
Expressive yet elegant nose with pineapple, acacia flowers, pomelo, white peach & papaya. 
Crisp, rounded palate with moderately pronounced flavors of lime, pineapple & orange, showing some sea minerals as well. 
Noticeable fresh fruity/floral finish.
Was fine with fried cavaniola and salad with baby 2013 unpublished

Unusual blend of Viognier/Catarratto (50/50) yielded bright, delicate & well-balanced Donnafugata product.
Polena welcomes us with pale lemon colour with greenish tinges.
Expressive yet elegant nose with pineapple, acacia flowers, pomelo, white peach & papaya. 
Crisp, rounded palate with moderately pronounced flavors of lime, pineapple & orange, showing some sea minerals as well. 
Noticeable fresh fruity/floral finish.
Was fine with fried cavaniola and salad with baby octopuses."},{"id":49709351,"rating":3.5,"note":"3.6 / Image of this wine is "Summer". Fresh and rich mineral. Tannin and acidity are well balanced, compete with each other providing a long finish.\nThis is a very well made wine, Burgundian style closer to Oregon’s PNs than CA’s heavy PNs in my experience.
